event.name: FREEMANTIS_DEMAND_INFO
event.text: You have little time to prepare before a Free Mantis dropship beams some crew aboard. They demand you explain why you are in their territory.
You explain your mission to the Free Mantis, and they seem to believe you. They transfer over some scrap in hopes it will help you succeed.

Seeing as you already have one of them on-board, you don't even have to finish your explanation before the Free Mantis start gathering supplies to aid you. They transfer over some resources in hopes it will help you succeed.
Just the sight of your Warlord aboard is enough to instantly convince them. The Free Mantis start gathering as many supplies as possible to aid you as a sign of good will.

Their team does a double take when they realize who's aboard your ship. The Free Mantis start gathering supplies to aid you, and one of them even desires to stay and help with your mission as a sign of good will.

Their team does a double take when they realize who's aboard your ship. The Free Mantis start gathering supplies to aid you, and one of them even desires to stay and help with your mission as a sign of good will.
The leader of the Free Mantis huffs. "Fine, then we take your ship and information as ours."

event.name: FREEMANTIS_SLAVE_OFFER
event.text: Two wrecks, both formerly Rebel ships, drift nearby. A Free Mantis ship hails you, its weapons raised boastfully in pride at its latest kill.
"Federation captain, have you seen latest kill?" You nod. "Yes, we hope to make proud."
"You, Federation, you have protected us, given us home when we had nowhere to go. You save us, we are forever grateful. We offer you a slave, from this pitiful Rebel ships we kill for you."
Two Free Mantis guards come aboard and throw the Rebel officer onto the ground in front of you. They wave happily with their sharpened claws and bid you farewell.
You explain that you aren't interested in slavery. "Oh... Yes yes, you Federation are so kind. Truly kinder than anyone else. Please, take some supplies. We beg of you to accept some gift from us."

event.name: FREEMANTIS_ENGI_SURRENDER
event.text: An Engi ship nearby hails you, as a Free Mantis ship approaches from behind.
"Danger: Imminent. Free Mantis in pursuit. Request: contact Free Mantis, ask for intent."

choice.text: Agree and contact the Free Mantis ship.

event.text: The Free Mantis captain seems happy to see you, and welcomes you to the sector. You waste no time and ask for his intent with the Engi. "Harm them? No. This war, very troubling. Alliances are crucial, and best way is through mutually beneficial agreements, such as a trade. But the Engi run, we suspect they are afraid. I promise, we wish them no harm."

choice.text: Explain the situation to the Engi.

event.text: "Gratitude, high. Appreciation, high. Simulated fear, low. Many thanks." The Engi pay you and jump away. The Free Mantis captain shrugs and thanks you for trying.

choice.text: (Engi Crew) "Your concern = warranted. Free Mantis however are: allies to the Federation."

event.text: Your Engi manages to convince them that the Free Mantis will be of no threat to them. They reluctantly believe you, and soon the Free Mantis ship catches up to both of you. "Harm? No. This war, very troubling. Alliances are crucial, and best way is through mutually beneficial agreements, such as a trade. Engi afraid, but promise, we wish no harm."

What follows between them is surely one of the most awkward exchange you've ever seen. They do both reward you for your assistance however, and soon after the Engi jump away. The Free Mantis captain shrugs and leaves you as well.
You tell the Engi that you can't help. They almost immediately jump away afterwards.
The Engi ship continues to try to contact you before giving up and jumping away. The Free Mantis ship lingers a bit longer before jumping away as well, in the opposite direction.

event.name: FREEMANTIS_EXECUTIONER
event.text: There is a rather large gathering of Free Mantis ships nearby. You don't know what's going on, but it might be important.

As you assimilate with the crowd, you notice most of the ships are empty. All of the Mantis seem to have gathered in one large capital ship in the center. You come aboard, confident there is no danger. You find yourself overlooking a large colosseum-like structure, and in the center stands a Mantis wielding a blade over a Human officer.

The executioner speaks to the crowd, "At last! We have caught infamous Captain Briggs of Rebel Fleet! We kill him, in the name of our Federation brothers!" A massive outroar from the crowd overwhelms the stadium as the executioner brings the sword down on the officer's head, slicing it clean off. Sickened by the show of brutality, you and your crew head back to your ship, not sure how to feel about what you just watched.

Your crew aren't sure of the idea of upsetting hundreds of Mantis, but you're set on the idea. You jump down from the balcony, push the executioner off of the Human, and carry him back to your ship, with an angry crowd in pursuit!

choice.text: Leave the Free Mantis to their business.

event.text: You slip away unnoticed, but you can't help but wonder what you might have missed.

You shake the human awake. He coughs, then stands up. "T-thanks. I... I was working as a Federation spy, but the Free Mantis attacked the Rebel ship I was working on and killed my crew, then took me hostage. I can't thank you enough for saving my life." You don't have time to talk further because the Mantis are already upon your ship!
The Human pushes you off of him, and you notice for the first time his Rebel uniform. He thanks you reluctantly. He's too injured to fight, so you leave him and focus on the boarders.

"In... in all my years, I've never seen anyone do what you just did, rescuing a complete stranger and putting your entire ship at risk. I... I feel ashamed for what I've done to your Federation brothers now. Please, let me serve your crew."

The Rebel captain tries to act indifferent, but you can tell he's grateful. "I suppose I am in your debt now. You are still my enemy, but I am an honourable man. I will give the fleet false information, it should delay them for some time."
The Rebel captain backs away from you. "Federation scum, this changes nothing. I don't know why you did this, but I don't care. Release me, or suffer the wrath of the Rebellion!"
"Excellent choice!" Your crew call you insane, but you drop him off at the nearest station unharmed. You know he'll report your position to the fleet, but you aren't savages.
You draw your laser and shoot the helpless captain. His lifeless body hits the floor, and you drag him to the airlock and send him flying out into the abyss. All of that for nothing then.

event.name: ENCOUNTER_FREEMANTIS_CONFUSED_NORMAL
event.text: You are hailed by a Free Mantis ship, whose captain immediately begins to slander you. "Rebel scum! You will rue the day you messed my clan! I will remove head, and bring it as gift to my Federation friends!" He roars and ends the transmission. You aren't sure how they confused you as a Rebel ship, but looks like there's no talking your way out of this one.

event.name: ENCOUNTER_FREEMANTIS_CONFUSED_REBEL
event.text: You are hailed by a Free Mantis ship, whose captain immediately begins to slander you. "Rebel scum! You will rue the day you messed my clan! I will remove head, and bring it as gift to my Federation friends!" He roars and ends the transmission. You have no one but yourself to blame this time, seeing as you had the splendid idea of flying an actual Rebel vessel right in the territory of the Free Mantis.

textList.name: TEXT_ENCOUNTER_ZOLTAN_FREEMANTIS
textList.text: The Zoltans have recently begun a much more concentrated attack on Free Mantis territory, and unfortunately sometimes ships get caught in the crossfire. This time, it appears you're one of them!
It's not usual for Zoltan ships to go out of their way to attack Federation ships they should be allied with, but an irate Zoltan captain nearby seems to think you're a threat and attacks!

"The Federation knows the Free Mantis have been a constant issue for the Ministry, and yet you chose to do nothing about it! I might not have direct orders, but no one will mind if you go missing after this conflict!"

The Zoltans seem to blame the Federation to some extent for the Free Mantis that have been "stealing" their territory. The ship at this beacon seems to have taken that to the next degree, because now they're attacking!

event.name: ENCOUNTER_ZOLTAN_FREEMANTIS_RESCUE
event.text: Ever since the Free Mantis stepped foot in Ministry territory, the two factions have been going at it for years. It looks like a Zoltan vessel is assaulting a Free Mantis outpost - but as soon as they see you they think you've come to assist the Mantis and attack!

textList.name: TEXT_ENCOUNTER_REBEL_FREEMANTIS
textList.text: Amongst the many wrecks of what was once a Free Mantis clan are three Rebel ships, their guns blazing. One of them spots you and attacks!
You receive a hail not long after jumping. "At last! I thought our detour into this forsaken sector would be the death of us, but now that you're here, things are starting to look up!"
Blaster fire batters your defences, and a Rebel ship moves in to attack!

The captain of the Rebel ship approaching you hails, "Do you know what trouble you've caused, creating these murderous psychopaths? Worse than the Hive Mantis, I can tell you that. Consider your deaths my revenge for the crew I've lost to your fanatics."
The Free Mantis have actively been searching out and killing Rebels in their territory, but the one here appears to have escaped from their grasp. They're quite eager to engage you!

textList.name: TEXT_ENCOUNTER_MANTIS_FREEMANTIS
textList.text: Two Mantis ships, one belonging to the Hive and the other to the Free Mantis duel nearby, and the Hive Mantis emerges victorious. Driven by bloodlust, they target you next.

The Mantis Hive does not appreciate the Free Mantis attempts at separating themselves, and rogue Mantis hunters often go out to hunt them down. The one at this beacon seems to be willing to settle with you as their target.
The views of the Mantis Hive and Free Mantis are polar opposites, and so are their opinions of the Federation. The Hive Mantis here are eager to take you down.
This beacon is abandoned by the Free Mantis, and for good reason. A Mantis hunter, waiting for its next prey, catches you and moves in to attack.

event.name: ENCOUNTER_FREEMANTIS_BOAST
event.text: An entourage of Free Mantis ships approach, and their leader hails you, boasting of his success in combat. "Human! You surely come to see myself in combat? Yes, see it you shall. Prepare to be amazed!"

event.name: FREEMANTIS_SUN
event.text: A Free Mantis ship and a sun both share this beacon. "Ah, fellow fighter! Welcome, and let us test skills against each other."

event.name: ENCOUNTER_MANTIS_FREEMANTIS_ASTEROID
event.text: A Mantis hunter adorned with Mantis intestines, most likely once belonging to the Free Mantis, is hiding in the nearby asteroid field. They move in to attack!

event.name: FREEMANTIS_PULSARRAID
event.text: The pulsar at this beacon is flooding this system with powerful electromagnetic pulses, but the entire Free Mantis fleet flying towards it doesn't seem to care! You watch as the ships approach the massive orb, with doubtful intent.

The Free Mantis leading the group appears to be a Warlord! However, he's so dopey from his pheromones that he can barely sling out an intelligible sentence. "P-pullllsar *hick* zap sssship! Heheh, we show... *hick* pulsar who boss in this ssssystem!"
"Dooooo not insult intelligence! I... *hick* kill you for this!"

choice.text: Scam them into buying some missiles to "blow up" the Pulsar.

event.text: "You arrrre most generous, captain! We take these, for use... *hick* in glorious battle!" You know these missiles will never do anything, but that's not your problem.

choice.text: (Engineer Crew) Have your Engineer explain how Pulsars work.

event.text: Your Engineer sits down with the Free Mantis, and takes almost half an hour explaining that a pulsar is just a star, and that a bunch of ships literally won't be able to do anything against it.

choice.text: (Shell Scientist Crew) Have your Scientist explain how Pulsars work.

event.text: Your Shell gathers the attention of the Free Mantis, and takes almost half an hour explaining that a pulsar is just a star, and that a bunch of ships literally won't be able to do anything against it.

choice.text: Whatever, you do you I guess.

event.text: You fly away from the Free Mantis, knowing their mission won't end very well.
You can't imagine what those ships are attempting to do, but you shouldn't get involved.
"Yyyyou not speak word of sense. Stupid creature, unlike me! Out of my ship, not worthy... *hick* being here."

It appears the Free Mantis are still sober enough to understand. "You... *hick* speak much sense. Man of science! Smart, llllike me! I feel generous, and you save life. Have... this fuel..." He orders his crew to give you some fuel and scrap and then falls unconscious.

event.name: FREEMANTIS_DEFEND
event.text: Your ship is almost immediately hailed by a nearby Free Mantis ship under attack by a Rebel. "Federation captain, please save us from Rebels!"
You fire up the weapons and prepare to defend your Mantis allies.
You try to ignore their pleas for help as you fly away.

event.name: FREEMANTIS_DEFEND_WIN
event.text: The Free Mantis are grateful for your aid. They pay you in thanks.

event.name: FREEMANTIS_THEFT
event.text: A few Free Mantis ships from different clans are trading supplies nearby. Most of them are small, and you could probably steal some of their supplies if you're up to the risk.

choice.text: Wait for the bigger ships to leave and then steal the supplies.

event.text: You don't need to get involved, and messing with multiple Free Mantis clans at once isn't a good idea.
It doesn't take long before your hopes at stealth are shattered as one of the larger ships catches you and attacks!

You wait. You wait some more. You find yourself startled awake by the sounds of gunfire. You were waiting so long a Rebel patrol ship has found you. The Free Mantis assume you must have been there to defend them, and are providing fire support.
Your waiting pays off, and eventually all that's left is one small Free Mantis scout. You move in to attack.

The Free Mantis are reluctantly willing to surrender. They hand over their cargo. As they fly away, you catch them yelling over the comms, "Damn you! We never forget this. We thought you were allies, but now we see truth."
The Free Mantis refuse to surrender. You have no choice but to keep fighting.
The cargo is a standard shipment of ammunition and a bomb launcher.
The cargo contains some additional scrap.
The cargo contains a drone and some additional drone parts.

Strange scratching noises come from inside the cargo. Your crew draw their guns and you slowly open the cargo. A Mantis soldier climbs out, gasping for breath. He explains that he was taken as a prisoner, but he never had an interest in fighting the Free Mantis. Now free from both his captors and the Hive, he is willing to join your crew and start a new life.
As you pry open the cargo, you hear a strange ticking noise. Luckily all of your crew manage to get out of the way in time, but it appears the Free Mantis trapped the cargo before handing it over!
The cargo is a standard shipment of ammunition and a bomb launcher.
The cargo contains some additional scrap.
The cargo contains a drone and some additional drone parts.

Strange scratching noises come from inside the cargo. Your crew draw their guns and you slowly open the cargo. A Mantis soldier climbs out, gasping for breath. He explains that he was taken as a prisoner, but he never had an interest in fighting the Free Mantis. Now free from both his captors and the Hive, he is willing to join your crew and start a new life.
The cargo is a standard shipment of ammunition and a bomb launcher.
The cargo contains some additional scrap.
The cargo contains a drone and some additional drone parts.

Strange scratching noises come from inside the cargo. Your crew draw their guns and you slowly open the cargo. A Mantis soldier climbs out, gasping for breath. He explains that he was taken as a prisoner, but he never had an interest in fighting the Free Mantis. Now free from both his captors and the Hive, he is willing to join your crew and start a new life.
It appears the cargo didn't survive the fight. There's little worth value to collect other than some scattered fuel cells.

event.name: FREEMANTIS_WIERD_TRADE
event.text: A lone Free Mantis ship nearby hails you. You are greeted by a Mantis dressed in a shirt decorated with 2D tropical flowers, and wearing a bizarre, beaten sombrero atop his head. "Welcome to beacon! I wish to show you most amazing prize of mine, but you must earn it!"
"Perfect! Prepare combat," his weapons go online, and you ready yours. If you want to prove yourself, you'll have to go for their hull and spare them in time.
The Mantis shakes his head, "Where your sense of fight? Disappointing." He ends transmissions.

event.name: FREEMANTIS_REBEL_SAVE
event.text: Rebel ships are all about, firing upon a group of unarmed civilians and a Free Mantis ship escorting them. You haven't been noticed.

choice.text: Take on the biggest ship to scare off the smaller Rebels.

event.text: You target the strongest of the Rebel ships, an Elite Bomber. This won't be fun.
You slip away quickly, still unnoticed. You won't have time to do anything on the ship, and should jump away as soon as possible.
You try to fly away, but a single Rebel ship from the crowd notices you.
The civilians are grateful. They all chip in together to pay you a sum of scrap for saving them.
The civilians are grateful, but their Free Mantis protector is especially so. They hail you in private. "I not lie... protecting civilians, not much fun. I suppose helping you, much better!"

It appears the civilian ships are in worse condition than you thought. The Free Mantis thanks you, but there is little to do to save the few survivors. They give you some extra fuel for your troubles.

event.name: DISTRESS_FREEMANTIS_STANDOFF
event.text: Your computer appears to be detecting two separate distress signals here, one from a Federation ship and the other from a Free Mantis ship.
Indeed, it appears a Federation vessel has gotten into a conflict with some Free Mantis. Who will you help?
This is Free Mantis territory, and you could use their help. You attack the Federation vessel.
The Free Mantis might usually be friendly, but the Federation are with who your true loyalties lie.

choice.text: No one, let's get out of here!

event.name: QUEST_FREEMANTIS_CAPTIVE
event.text: You receive a distress call from a Free Mantis clan, who eagerly request your assistance. "Our chief, Kakpakakakakakakakakakakakak has been captured by Suzerains! Please, you must save him!"
"You are of the kindest beings! Here are co-ordinates, and please bring us back Kakpakakakakakakakakakakakak alive!"
You don't have time to go tracking down missing Free Mantis. You apologize and leave.

event.name: FREEMANTIS_JAILER_ARRIVAL
event.text: You've found the Suzerain ship you've been tracking! They seem to know you're following them - or maybe they're just really angry - because they attack you as soon as you enter the system!

event.name: QUEST_FREEMANTIS_MATE
event.text: It isn't clear what you're looking at at first, but it appears to be the aftermath of two Free Mantis ships colliding with each other at a high velocity. There seems to be minimal power signatures and one of the engines miraculously is still running, but you aren't sure anyone is actually alive.

choice.text: You cannot scrap the remains all on your own.

event.text: To your surprise, you almost immediately receive a response. A cheerful Mantis speaks. "Ah! Federation, this is most fortuitous time. As you see, we are in major predicament. Many my brothers die, but they die valiantly. Are you here to save?"
"Oh, yes. We see Engi do this. Two ships, come together quickly, and they make bigger, stronger ship! We try it too. However, it doesn't work as expected. Clearly, we forgot step."

choice.text: Try to pry their ships apart.

event.text: "Oh, I don't think that's greatest of idea. True, we did pretty stupid thing. But, too late to separate ships."

choice.text: Offer to transport their crew to their clan.

event.text: "Oh, greatest of thanks. I bring my friends, one second." A large group of ten or so Free Mantis come aboard carrying various possessions. You tell them to make themselves home in the cargo bay until you can find their clan grounds.

"Oh, understandable. You have important Fed things to do, yes. But, if it happens, here are locations of clan. Maybe you see them, and tell them where we are?" You agree to notify their clan if you happen to see them.

choice.text: Offer to transport their crew to their clan.

event.text: "Oh, greatest of thanks. I bring my friends, one second." A large group of ten or so Free Mantis come aboard carrying various possessions. You tell them to make themselves home in the cargo bay until you can find their clan grounds.

"Oh, understandable. You have important Fed things to do, yes. But, if it happens, here are locations of clan. Maybe you see them, and tell them where we are?" You agree to notify their clan if you happen to see them.
You don't feel like looting wrecks that might still have survivors aboard. You leave them to drift.
You start taking apart the outer hull when there's banging on your doors. You have little time to react until a swarm of Mantis overtake your ship, killing one of your crew.

removeCrew.text: Dazed but alive, your cloned crew stumbles out of the Clone Bay and prepares to defend.

event.text: Nothing disturbs you as you loot the ship. There are corpses of Mantis everywhere, but nothing alive.
As you're in the midst of taking apart the outer hull, a Free Mantis ship of the same clan jumps nearby. They spot you and waste no time avenging their fallen clan members.

event.name: FREEMANTIS_MATE_RESCUE_CLAN
event.text: You have arrived at the location of the Free Mantis clan. You drop off the survivors, and the clan thanks you greatly. They offer you one of their finest soldiers in tribute.

event.name: FREEMANTIS_MATE_CLAN
event.text: You have arrived at the location of the Free Mantis clan. You explain the situation to the clan leader, who seems rather perplexed. "Yes... they aren't smartest of Mantis. Still, we thank you." They gather a group to go retrieve the survivors, and pay you in scrap.

event.name: FREEMANTIS_FLEET_MONITION
event.text: This system appears to be primarily empty, save for a singular Free Mantis vessel. Biometric scans, even from long range, show they're panicking, though nothing on their ship seems out of the ordinary.

"Oh dear oh dear oh dear oh dear oh dear oh dear, we doomed, royally screwed, very oh not good! Zoltan, Mantis, working together, sent massive fleet, attacking Freddy, grand leader of ours! This truly end of Free Mantis, all is doomed!"

choice.text: Calm down, maybe we can help.

event.text: "YOU HELP?! MOST WONDERFUL YES! TAKE COORDINATES, HURRY HURRY, NOT TIME TO LOSE!" The Mantis transmit the coordinates of a Mantis Bishop. This ship must be the one keeping "Freddy" captive.
"OH OH, ONE MORE! MANY THANKS, FEDERATION!" The Mantis transmit more coordinates, this time of a Zoltan cruiser. This ship must be the one leading the attack.

choice.text: These guys are crazy, we need to leave.

event.text: These guys are probably crazed pheromone addicts, nothing worth messing with.

destroyed.text: The Bishop vessel has been destroyed. The Hive is now short of one more Bishop, but the Free Mantis are now short of one more leader as well.

deadCrew.text: The last of the Mantis warriors have fallen, and the Bishop vessel comes to a halt.

event.name: FREEMANTIS_FLEET_BISHOP
event.text: You've arrived at the coordinates given, where you find a very well armed Bishop vessel. On your vid screen appears a Mantis Bishop, one of Queen Leikonpliiinakra's own ruling sovereigns!

"Ugh, Federation filth? Zoltan promised you would not interfere. Nevermind it, you here now, so we fight!" If you want to save Freddy from them, you'll have to kill their crew... which could prove to be quite the challenge.

event.name: FREEMANTIS_FLEET_FREDDYSAVE
event.text: You dig through the cargobay of the Bishop ship, and find a prison hold. One cell is marked by a crudely written document describing its prisoner as "dumb stupid free mantis leader man".

You pry open the prison cell, only to be greeted by an elegant and well composed Free Mantis sipping tea through an antique human teapot. He speaks to you in a suave and unnaturally human voice. "Ahhh, friends. Welcome to my most... er, humble abode. Yes yes, quite humble indeed. Would you care to join me? Come, have a seat. You can have my chair, my biology is not well suited for sitting anyways."

"Why yes, technically. That is the name I go by. A long time ago I met a man, a kind man, and I taught him my language. In return, he taught me his. He struggled to say my name, and so he gave me a new one. My real name has too many syllables, it brings an unpleasant taste to my tongue. So please, call me Freddy."

choice.text: You seem unusually well spoken for a Mantis.

event.text: Freddy snorts. "Yes well, we could all speak this well if we gave ourselves a proper education and didn't rot our braincells away with pheromones. I'm one of the original founders of the Free Mantis. Yes yes, I know, I'm quite old. But make no hasty assumptions, I'm as skilled a fighter as they come. Just let my armor be evidence. These claws have laid waste to some of Leikonpliiinakra's finest Bishops."

"Now then, without further ado... You've come here to rescue me, yes?" He wastes no time waiting for you to respond. "Let us hurry. I wish to linger as little as possible in this dank cave of suffering. I do hope you have tea aboard your vessel..."

destroyed.text: "NOOOOO, HOW COULD THIS BE? THE EYE NEVER LIIIIEEEESSSSS!" The Monk cruiser explodes, sending rainbow pieces of debris flying in all directions.

deadCrew.text: "NOOOOO, HOW COULD THIS BE? THE EYE NEVER LIIIIEEEESSSSS!" The Monk cruiser suddenly falls silent, void of any life signs.

event.name: FREEMANTIS_FLEET_ZOLTAN
event.text: You've arrived at the coordinates given, where you find a strangely colored Monk Cruiser. On your vid screen appears a colorfully robed monk, probably some prestigious prophet of sorts.

"I foresaw you coming here. You have come to kill us, in the name of the barbaric Mantis laborers that you continue to manipulate for your own gain? Truly sad, but it matters little. As the Great Eye has promised me, thou shall not be alive much longer!"

choice.text: Isn't murder against the monk lifestyle?

event.text: "Welllll yes, but I'm sure the Great Eye won't mind, and holy texts can always be appended. Besides, I won't be the one killing you. My men will!"

event.name: FREEMANTIS_FLEET_ZOLTAN_WIN
event.text: The ASB in the distance stops as the Zoltan fleet falls silent. "Well uh, now that the prophet is dead, we'll just leave I guess. No one really cared about the Free Mantis other than him anyways." The Zoltan jump away.

Several Free Mantis ships jump in, applauding you. "Federation did it, liberated us from attackers! They save all Free Mantis from Zoltan plague! They hero, chant for them!" The Free Mantis begin to chant your name in unison, and several ships are sent forth to bestow you with many gifts of honor.

event.name: FREEMANTIS_ZOLTAN_KILLER
event.text: The Free Mantis haven't reacted well to the Zoltan's aggressive resistance to their presence, but the ship at this beacon appears to have taken that to the next level...
"Federation? Have come to admire brilliant arsenal of disgusting Zoltan piglet murder? If wanted, we share tech with you, so you may murder energy freak too!"
"Enjoy murdering, Federation! Come by again sometime, and we share mutual stories of hunt!"

choice.text: Ask about their large Beam weapon.

event.text: "Eh? This is Zoltan Deleter, cherished weapon that murder Zoltan fast! But not to kill others, that rude. If Federation want gun, they must prove worthy!"
"Oh? Then let most daunting battle begin!"
"Heheh, smart choice. None best me yet, Zoltan Deleter mine forever!"
"Alright, not all scrap spent when sometimes arsenal already kill!"
If these guys are willing to go this far to express their hatred of the Zoltan, chances are they won't be very friendly to others either.

event.name: FREEMANTIS_PHEROMONES
event.text: The nearby planet is home to a large Zoltan city, whose original population has since abandoned it in favor of its new Free Mantis inhabitants.

choice.text: Land, the Free Mantis should welcome us.

event.text: You land near a coastal region, where you find a peace-keeper vessel waiting! Some Free Mantis are shouting at it, but an armed battalion of peace-keepers stands stonefaced watching them.

It appears the Zoltans are actually stationed in front of a huge laboratory. You don't know what the Free Mantis are using the factory for, but clearly it is high enough priority for the Zoltans to target it.
Attacking a Zoltan Peacekeeper in technically Zoltan territory in order to defend Free Mantis inhabiting an ex-Zoltan city? An action bold enough that it might actually work!
You don't care to disturb the Free Mantis and ignore the city.

event.name: FREEMANTIS_PHEROMONES_WIN
event.text: The Free Mantis cheer for you as you land once again. "Federation has done it, saving us from Zoltan!"

"This? This pheromone concoction laboratory! Here, make finest pheromones. Though, very addictive, sometimes crippling. Oh well, they make soldier very strong! Here, have some, may bring great toughness to crew."

event.name: FREEMANTIS_BURIAL
event.text: At first you think the ship nearby might be a transport, but scans show it has been repurposed as a mass grave for the Free Mantis! In Free Mantis culture, the dead are buried with their finest weapons. Maybe we can loot something from the ship?

choice.text: Attack and take what you can!

event.text: "Eek! Ship attacking, run run!" It seems the Free Mantis are running!

choice.text: Request to come aboard and take some stuff.

event.text: "What?! No no no, we cannot allow. These possession key to gate of great beyond! Cannot offering anything more than apologies."
"Eek! Ship attacking, run run!" It seems the Free Mantis are running!

choice.text: (Free Mantis Crew) Convince them it's for a good cause.

event.text: "Well... maybe souls understand, if their key used in name of Federation? Go ahead, take it."
You hand over some scrap to the Free Mantis, in hopes they'll accept the bribe...
You aren't willing to harass the Free Mantis and their past. You apologize and leave.
The Free Mantis refuse, but generously give back the scrap. "We cannot let you on. Sorry for refusal, but requesting you please stop trying."
"You are making convincing offer... we take this, and let you dig up weapon. Only from bad person though, who probably deserve it..."

event.name: ENCOUNTER_FREEMANTIS_ELITE
event.text: The Free Mantis have designated this sector as their hunting grounds, and as such many powerful Free Mantis Warlords linger, waiting for prey. Though they don't usually target Federation ships, it seems the elite vessel here is taking its chances!

event.name: ENCOUNTER_SUZERAIN_HUNTGROUNDS
event.text: Suzerains aren't a common sight outside of the Mantis Hive, but the one here appears to have been hunting Free Mantis. They aren't keen on letting you go, so prepare for combat!
